statement.title: Problem Description
statement.content: Let f(x) = a<sub>n</sub>x<sup>n</sup> +...+  a<sub>1</sub>x +a<sub>0</sub>, in which a<sub>i</sub> (0 <= i <= n) are all known integers. We call f(x)  0 (mod m) congruence equation. If m is a composite, we can factor m into powers of primes and solve every such single equation after which we merge them using the Chinese Reminder Theorem. In this problem, you are asked to solve a much simpler version of such equations, with m to be prime's square.

statement.title: Input
statement.content:
The first line is the number of equations T, T<=50.
　　Then comes T lines, each line starts with an integer deg (1<=deg<=4), meaning that f(x)'s degree is deg. Then follows deg integers, representing an to a0 (0 < abs(an) <= 100; abs(ai) <= 10000 when deg >= 3, otherwise abs(ai) <= 100000000, i<n). The last integer is prime pri (pri<=10000).
　　Remember, your task is to solve f(x) 0 (mod pri*pri)

statement.title: Output
statement.content: For each equation f(x)  0 (mod pri*pri), first output the case number, then output anyone of x if there are many x fitting the equation, else output "No solution!"

statement.title: Sample Output
statement.content:
Case #1: No solution!
Case #2: 599
Case #3: 96255626
Case #4: No solution!
